segments.pli: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabban”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, how many qualities should a mendicant have to give ordination?”

segments.pli: “Dasahi kho, upāli, dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṃ.
segments.en: “Upāli, a mendicant should have ten qualities to give ordination.

segments.pli: Idhupāli, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.

segments.pli: bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;
segments.en: They’re very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned. These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, reinforcing them by recitation, mentally scrutinizing them, and comprehending them theoretically.

segments.pli: pātimokkhaṃ kho panassa vitthārena svāgataṃ hoti suvibhattaṃ suppavattaṃ suvinicchitaṃ suttaso anubyañjanaso;
segments.en: Both monastic codes have been passed down to them in detail, well analyzed, well mastered, well judged in both the rules and accompanying material.

segments.pli: paṭibalo hoti gilānaṃ upaṭṭhātuṃ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṃ vā;
segments.en: They’re able to care for the sick or get someone else to do so.

segments.pli: paṭibalo hoti anabhiratiṃ vūpakāsetuṃ vā vūpakāsāpetuṃ vā;
segments.en: They’re able to settle dissatisfaction or get someone else to do so.

segments.pli: paṭibalo hoti uppannaṃ kukkuccaṃ dhammato vinodetuṃ;
segments.en: They’re able to dispel remorse when it has come up.

segments.pli: paṭibalo hoti uppannaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ dhammato vivecetuṃ;
segments.en: They’re able to rationally dissuade someone from misconceptions that come up.
They’re able to encourage someone in the higher ethics,

segments.pli: Imehi kho, upāli, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabban”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant should have these ten qualities to give ordination.”
